page.title: 06HOUSING IN HASTINGS
page.content: Housing in Hastings is of differing styles of architecture. The earliest housing is Tudor, constructed from timber frames, wattle and daub, tiled roofs and latticed windows. These are found in the Old Town. Later houses are brick, plastered internally with slate roofs and larger windows. Georgian and Regency buildings have simple elegant proportions. Many Hastings buildings are Victorian and range from ornate mansions to terraced cottages. Hastings has expanded in this century.Many semi detached houses and bungalows have been built more suitable to the lifestyle of smaller families than the larger Victorian buildings. Many of these have been turned into flats.
